result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lysandra M. King

records.addlTxt:
Adjustment Number: 22A 035915,
Payable Number: 67414,
Receipt Number: 22R 004345,
Amount: $20.00

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
for Bond Reduction
Routed to Judge's JA

Maintain Absolute Sobriety. 
No illegal use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. 
No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license. 
No contact with victims or victims residence. 
Def. to take prescriptions only as prescribed. 
Def. not to obtain any dangerous weapons as defined by statute. 
Defendant to apply with Public Defender within 7 days at 715-536-9105.

1:45 PM Defendant Lysandra M. King appeared by video, in custody in Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin. Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given Atty rights and given 4 options, PD, hire own, court appointed Atty. or represent self. Def. does wish to attain counsel. Defendant to apply with Public Defender within 7 days at 715-536-9105. State is in compliance with victims rights. State gives bail bond recommendations and requests a $10,000.00 cash bond with conditions to Maintain Absolute Sobriety, No illegal use or possession of controlled substances, No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license, No contact with victims or victims property, Def. to take prescriptions only as prescribed, Def. not to obtain any dangerous weapons and Defendant to apply with Public Defender within 7 days at 715-536-9105. Def. gives bail bond argument. Court has reviewed criminal complaint, considers factors and orders a $20,000.00 cash bond with conditions to Maintain Absolute Sobriety, No illegal use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription, No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license, No contact with victim or victims residence, Def. to take prescription only as prescribed, Def. not to obtain any dangerous weapons as defined by statute and Defendant to apply with Public Defender within 7 days at 715-536-9105. State requests Court address competency concerns. Court orders Def. to competency evaluation.
Status conference scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
